citation.article-title: Halomethanococcus doii gen. nov., sp. nov.: an obligately halophilic methanogenic bacterium from solar salt ponds.
citation.source: The Journal of General and Applied Microbiology

p.s: Halomethanococcus (Hal. o. me. tha. no. coc'cus Gr. n. hals,halos the sea, salt; M. L. n. methanum methane; Gr. n. coccus a berry; M. L. masc. n. Halomethanococcus the salt-methane coccus)
Cells: Gram negative, pleomorphic cocci 0.3-1.5 μm in diameter, occurring singly, or in small irregular clumps, non-motile, thin cell wall.
Salt requirement: Minimum 1.8 M NaCl required for growth.
Can grow up to 3.6 M NaCl.
The type species of the genus Halomethanococcus is H. doii sp. nov.
